reviewText: This is possibly one of the worst films ever made, but I do not regret I bought and watched it, as it has also a little element of "so bad that almost good".Except for the title and the fact that the main character is a woman, this film has NOTHING to do with the "She" novel by H. Rider Haggard. The "story" - if one can use this word - occurs in some near future, after some mysterious disaster ("The Cancellation"), on the ruins of our civilization. In principle it is the story of a young blond hunk looking for his abducted sister, travelling in company of his dark haired friend. But the whole film is mostly the pretext to show very generously the amazing bodies of two main female protagonists - the Queen Goddess She (Sandahl Bergman) and her female bodyguard Shandra (Quin Kessler). The whole film has actually the kind of scenario and acting of a soft porn film, which just doesn't dare to show full intercourse...)))Other than the two girls (who are indeed absolutely amazing beauties, both clothed and unclothed) the other reasons for which I give it two stars are the incredible costumes and weapons of the "bad guys" (the Norks, who according to some were supposed to be the degenerate descendants of New Yorkers...) and especially one very original, clever and funny scene with a sailor who is the lone guard watching the bridge to the "bad guys" (Norks) domain. Well, as you will see, he hardly needs any reinforcements at his post...)))Now, this film being considered by some as a "cult" movie, I am glad that I finally saw it - but I do not think I will see it another time. Ever. As for you, well, you may want to try to find it on the internet rather than buying the DVD, as this is, in my opinion, a "see once" thing.
summary: A weird, very bad film, with horrible actors and "level 0" scenario - but also with two very hot chicks and ONE A++ scene...

reviewText: This is a completely stupid film that makes very little sense and has uniformly bad acting (not that that is the actor's fault really, given the script). It bears no resemblance to the Rider Haggard classic. However, it is quite unintentionally amusing and to give her her due, Sandahl Bergman is, at least to me, the sexiest "She" to date. Worth watching on a wet weekend if you are at a loose end and you don't take it in any way seriously. If you laugh at it, it actually becomes quite bearable.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This belongs in the top ten worst films of all time.  Watching this movie you can actually feel your IQ points dropping.
Title: N/A

reviewText: A forgotten cult classic. Sandahl Bergman tears up the screen with her presence, beauty, and fighting skills. Overwhelmingly convincing as the goddess she, little is said by her, yet Bergman is still able to hypnotize when only walking into a room. Not much dialog and the camera loves her anyway, so we get an overdose of eye candy as sandahl physically expresses herself in several graceful dances of death. Quin Kessler matches Bergman's intensity as her faithful servant/bodyguard and reveals her own hotness!  Two wandering warriors/barbarians kidnap a warrior queen and use her knowledge of the landscape to save their sister taken by a punk/goth army. The two male heroes are buff but goofy and not as intimidating or as focused as Sandahl and Quin. As the four travel through the gauntlet of challenges, things get more and more weird (in a good way). Thankfully, no matter what happens, Bergman and Kessler's sexy female magnetism are constantly on display. "She" a  post apocalyptic sword and sorcery nightmare that succeeds by using original ideas to keep things unpredictable. Rock soundtrack fits well. Pal fullscreen dvd picture is decent and audio very good.
summary: Sandahl Bergman and Quin Kessler rule the wasteland
Title: N/A

reviewText: All movies require to some degree the willing suspension of disbelief. This movie never got to the point of drawing me in. Sandahl Bergman and Quin Kessler just looked like little girls playing with swords. The fight scenes are terrible altho they do get a little better as the movie progresses. The male leads get the living daylights stomped out of them, get stabbed, shot, etc and the next scene they seem uninjured. In the big fight at the end, these guys who have been losing every fight they get into all of a sudden go all Seven Samurai and fight a whole army to a standstill. Apparently whatever caused the Apocalyps that this movie is post basically killed all humans with basic reasoning skills leaving these idiots to wander around getting beat up and doing totally random stuff to pass the time.
summary: I really wanted to like this movie...
Title: N/A
